footnotes.text: Subjects who complete up to 6 treatment cycles or who discontinue treatment prior to reaching an event of disease progression are to continue visits and radiographic assessments until progression.
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Creates conditional branch logic based on treatment completion status AND affects visit scheduling continuation.

footnotes.text: The Screening Visit must be performed within 28 days of randomization.
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Specifies a timing window (28 days) for the screening visit, affecting visit scheduling.

footnotes.text: When an Investigator has determined that a subject should discontinue the study, a Final Visit will be conducted.
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Creates conditional branch triggered by investigator determination of study discontinuation.

footnotes.text: A Follow-Up visit is required if the Final Visit is < 30 days from the last administration of drug.
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Creates conditional branch based on timing between final visit and last drug administration.

footnotes.text: Following completion of platinum doublet therapy, maintenance pemetrexed 500 mg q3 weeks is strongly encouraged for all subjects who are suitable candidates. For those subjects in maintenance therapy, tumor assessments will be completed q9 weeks until radiographic progression.
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Creates conditional branch for suitable candidates AND specifies recurrence pattern (q3 weeks, q9 weeks).

footnotes.text: Must be performed prior to initiation of any screening or study-specific procedures. Informed Consent may be obtained before 28 day screening window.
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Specifies timing constraint for informed consent relative to other procedures and screening window.

footnotes.text: Physical exam not required, if performed within 7 days prior to randomization. Height is only measured at Screening.
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Creates conditional branch based on recent physical exam AND provides operational instruction about height measurement.

footnotes.text: May occur up to 4 calendar days before C1D-2 to facilitate dispensing and morning administration of Study Drug.
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Specifies timing window (up to 4 days before) for randomization to facilitate drug dispensing.

footnotes.text: Serum pregnancy test will be done at Screening. Urine pregnancy test will be done prior to dosing at C1D-2 unless the serum pregnancy test was collected within 7 days of C1D-2. Local urine pregnancy testing should also be performed at each subsequent Cycle Day 1 visit. The test results must be reviewed and determined to be negative prior to dosing. A positive urine pregnancy test will be confirmed with a serum pregnancy test. Pregnancy tests may also be repeated per the discretion of the Investigator at any time during the study.
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Creates conditional branches for pregnancy testing based on timing and gender, includes operational procedures for test handling.

footnotes.text: Study samples for central laboratory analysis may be performed within 72 hours of the scheduled day. A qualified (e.g., certification or accreditation) local laboratory may be used to perform laboratory analyses for treatment decisions but this cannot replace the central laboratory analysis on a protocol defined visit.
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Specifies timing window (72 hours) for laboratory samples AND provides operational instructions about laboratory types.

footnotes.text: Baseline tumor assessments must be conducted within 28 days (inclusive) of randomization. Post-baseline tumor assessment will be conducted within 7 days prior to chemotherapy on C3D1 and C5D1, every 9 weeks ± 7 days from the last scan after treatment discontinuation until 1 year on study (or beyond 1 year until maintenance therapy is discontinued), and then every 12 weeks ± 7 days. If desired, tumor assessments during protocol therapy may be coordinated to occur on treatment initiation Days C3D1 and C5D1.
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Specifies complex recurrence patterns and timing windows for tumor assessments throughout study.

footnotes.text: An unscheduled tumor assessment should be performed if the subject discontinues from the study for a reason other than radiographic progression, and no scan has been performed within the last 4 weeks.
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Creates conditional branch triggered by study discontinuation without progression and timing since last scan.

footnotes.text: Baseline MRI of the brain only for subjects with suspected metastases due to neurologic signs or symptoms. A CT scan may be performed if an MRI is contraindicated.
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Creates conditional branch based on clinical indication (suspected metastases) with alternative procedure option.

footnotes.text: Questionnaires for the assessment of quality of life will be collected prior to dosing on C1D-2, C3D1, C5D1 and at the Final Visit, every 9 weeks until 1 year after beginning therapy (C1D-2) ± 7 days (or beyond 1 year until maintenance therapy is discontinued), then every 12 weeks ± 7 days and at the Final Visit.
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Specifies complex recurrence pattern and timing for QoL questionnaire collection throughout study.

footnotes.text: Sufficient medication will be dispensed to cover the entire cycle. The site is advised to contact the subject on the morning of Day –2 to reiterate the dosing instructions of pre-chemotherapy-veliparib. It is recommended the site contact the subject on Day 5 to instruct about ceasing dosing.
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Provides operational instructions for site procedures regarding drug dispensing and patient contact, no EDC automation impact.

footnotes.text: Carboplatin and paclitaxel are to be given only after veliparib dosing on cycle Day -2 and Day -1 are confirmed.
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Creates conditional branch requiring confirmation of prior veliparib dosing before chemotherapy administration.

footnotes.text: Following treatment discontinuation, subjects will have post-treatment visits q9 weeks until one year after randomization, then q12 weeks until radiographic progression or death.
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Specifies recurrence pattern for post-treatment visits with transition from q9 weeks to q12 weeks.

footnotes.text: Screening ECOG may be used to stratify during a randomization call if randomization is performed prior to C1D-2.
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Creates conditional branch for using screening ECOG based on randomization timing relative to C1D-2.

footnotes.text: All systemic post treatment anti-cancer therapy, if applicable and available, will be collected in the survival follow-up period.
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Creates conditional branch for collecting anti-cancer therapy data if applicable and available during survival follow-up.
